decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also seeks to gain card advantage through card draw and card selection effects. Additionally, the deck includes cards to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies, as well as a diverse array of threats to close out the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and to maximize efficiency. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The key focus of this deck is to control and disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through efficient spells and mana acceleration. With a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful draw spells, the deck aims to stay ahead in resources and outvalue the opponent. Utilizing a mix of disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog alongside powerful spells like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall, this deck aims to control the game tempo and win through incremental advantage.

The deck aims to combo off using Doomsday to manipulate library, draw Thassa's Oracle and win the game immediately. The deck includes various card draw and manipulation spells, along with disruption spells like Force of Will to protect the combo. It also includes fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate the combo. The deck focuses on efficiently assembling the combo pieces and winning the game in a single turn.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mana Crypt, alongside powerful mana rocks such as Moxen and Sol Ring. The key strategy revolves around using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand, drawing cards and generating mana in the process. The deck also includes ways to untap artifacts like Time Vault and The One Ring to take extra turns and eventually win the game. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility by shutting down opponent's artifacts and tutoring for key pieces when needed.

This deck focuses on disruption and card advantage through powerful spells like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor. It also utilizes efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Nethergoyf to pressure the opponent while controlling the game with cards like Fatal Push and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to out-tempo the opponent by playing threats and disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with its aggressive and midrange strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play out Oath of Druids, utilizing cards like Show and Tell and Tinker to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It also includes a variety of control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own game plan. The deck aims to overpower opponents with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining control of the game through strategic decision-making and resource management.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to execute a game-winning combo using cards like Flash and Dread Return. By utilizing powerful mana acceleration cards and efficient card draw spells, the deck can quickly storm off and win the game in one explosive turn. The primary win condition is to mill the opponent's entire library using creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, ultimately winning the game with Thassa's Oracle's "win the game" ability. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on using efficient removal and counter spells to control the game, while generating card advantage using Lrien Revealed and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Nihil Spellbomb for additional value. The mana base is optimized to support its three colors, with the inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus to accelerate its game plan. The deck's goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a dominant board presence to secure the win.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and midrange control using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to stay ahead in the game. It utilizes powerful card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, alongside key disruption tools like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of consistency and resilience to the deck. By combining speed, disruption, and resilience, the deck aims to apply pressure on opponents while maintaining control of the game state.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Doomsday to set up a winning sequence of cards, often including Thassa's Oracle and other key spells. The deck is highly efficient and aims to quickly combo off while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. It also includes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to find the pieces needed for the combo. The deck is designed for a fast, decisive victory in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By leveraging powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, along with disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to keep the opponent off balance and make it difficult for them to enact their game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's triple-colored requirements while also providing utility with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of low-cost permanents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and disruption with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent through efficient play and resource management.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hatebears like Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Seasoned Dungeoneer. It also utilizes cards like Solitude and Swords to Plowshares for removal, and includes cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to restrict the opponent's ability to play spells. The deck aims to control the game by taxing the opponent's resources and preventing them from executing their game plan effectively, ultimately overwhelming them with its aggressive threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies through hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer to apply pressure. With cards like Eldrazi Displacer for extra utility and protection from targeted removal, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures. The mana base includes powerful artifacts like Moxen and lands like Ancient Tomb to help accelerate the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early on. It also utilizes control elements like counterspells (Force of Will, Flusterstorm) and disruption (Strip Mine) to control the game. Show and Tell and Tinker are additional ways to cheat out threats, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns provide utility and board control. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence to win the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with countermagic and removal spells while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. The main strategy involves using cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Abrupt Decay to control the board and protect key threats such as Oko, Thief of Crowns and Collector Ouphe. The deck also utilizes powerful mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to cast game-changing spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. Overall, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on denying the opponent's resources through counterspells and removal spells while maintaining card advantage with efficient card draw and selection spells. It also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional recursion for low-cost permanents. The mana base is designed to disrupt the opponent's mana while ensuring the deck can cast a variety of spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient use of its resources.

This deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo as quickly as possible to win the game. The key strategy involves using cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Doomsday to set up a winning sequence of cards in the library, followed by using Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck also includes various forms of disruption and card draw to protect the combo and ensure it can be executed efficiently. The goal is to create a game-winning scenario with minimal interaction from the opponent.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Doomsday combo deck revolves around quickly assembling the necessary cards to cast Doomsday, allowing the player to stack their deck in a way that will lead to a game-winning Thassa's Oracle or other win condition. The deck includes a variety of fast mana acceleration, card draw, and counterspells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategies. By carefully planning out their Doomsday pile and efficiently executing the combo, players can achieve a swift victory in this high-powered format.

The main concept of this deck is to lock down the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Null Rod. The deck aims to take advantage of mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Sol Ring to play aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Magus of the Moon. Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon are used to disrupt multicolor decks, while cards like Fury and Pyrogoyf provide additional aggression. The deck also includes removal options like Shatterskull Smashing to deal with opposing threats.

This deck utilizes graveyard recursion and self-mill to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and trigger powerful synergy effects, such as bringing back Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba from the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures while maintaining control with cards like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void. By aggressively dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, the deck can quickly set up explosive plays and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The main focus of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Ichorid, triggering abilities that allow for explosive plays with cards like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. By utilizing cards like Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad to cycle through the deck quickly, combined with disruption from Force of Will and Force of Negation, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a rapid and relentless graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on a control strategy, using counterspells, card draw, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts and companions like Lurrus of the Dream-Den to generate value and maintain consistency. By controlling the board and outlasting the opponent, this deck aims to establish dominance and secure victory by efficiently managing resources and making precise decisions throughout the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Psychic Frog. The inclusion of powerful mana rocks like Mox Sapphire and Black Lotus allows for fast and efficient mana ramp, enabling the player to cast game-changing spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. Additionally, the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining aggressive pressure. It uses hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's spells, while also utilizing cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer to control the board. The deck also includes mana acceleration and disruption cards like Chrome Mox and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a combination of hatebears, disruptive spells, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to control the game and emerge victorious through a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on assembling a disruptive board presence through aggressive creatures with hatebear abilities, limiting the opponent's options and slowing down their game plan. By utilizing powerful hate cards like Containment Priest, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, combined with efficient mana acceleration and disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to control the game early and maintain pressure throughout. With a mix of disruptive creatures and hate cards, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategies while presenting a clock to close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to quickly put powerful creatures into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes control elements like counterspells and removal to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck includes powerful cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall to accelerate its game plan, as well as versatile threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The goal is to control the game while also quickly deploying threats to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck aims to quickly assemble powerful artifacts such as The One Ring, Coveted Jewel, and Grim Monolith to generate a massive amount of mana. Paradoxical Outcome is used to return these artifacts to hand, allowing for card draw and further mana generation. The deck also includes combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key, along with controlling elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. With the ability to consistently generate large amounts of mana and protect its combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

This deck revolves around generating infinite mana and card advantage through the combination of cards like Grim Monolith, Manifold Key, and Paradoxical Outcome. By continuously bouncing artifacts with Paradoxical Outcome, the deck can draw into its win conditions, such as The One Ring or Coveted Jewel. With access to powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Tinker, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning combo that overwhelms the opponent. The presence of disruptive cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor ensures the deck can protect its combo and disrupt opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on using powerful mana-producing artifacts like Moxen and Mana Crypt to set up explosive turns where it can generate a large amount of mana quickly. By utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker, the deck aims to assemble key pieces like Time Vault and Grim Monolith to create a game-winning combo. The inclusion of disruption like Force of Will and Trinisphere helps protect the combo and disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck also has ways to generate card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Sensei's Divining Top to ensure it can find the necessary pieces to go off successfully.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Blazing Rootwalla and Vengevine to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By cycling through cards with Bazaar of Baghdad and utilizing cards like Noxious Revival and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to maintain board control and apply pressure early on. The inclusion of cards like Hollow One and Fury adds versatility and adaptability to the deck, allowing for different lines of play depending on the situation. This deck is built to dominate the early game and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold. The deck utilizes powerful card draw and removal spells to control the game and grind out opponents in a midrange battle. The mana base is built to support the deck's three color requirements with plenty of fetch lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck is designed to disrupt opponents while deploying threats to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible using artifacts like Moxen, Mana Crypt, and Grim Monolith, in order to cast powerful spells and activate abilities that can lead to infinite loops or game-winning combos. Cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Paradox Engine help to draw cards and untap mana sources, while cards like Voltaic Key and Time Vault can create extra turns. Karn, the Great Creator can also lock opponents out of the game with Mycosynth Lattice. The deck thrives on assembling pieces quickly and overwhelming opponents with its synergies.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Grief and Psychic Frog. Through card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, combined with efficient threats like Reanimate and Troll of Khazad-dm, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of powerful restricted cards like Black Lotus and Time Walk provides additional ways to gain an advantage and close out games quickly. The deck's strategy is to maintain control of the game while applying pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and resources using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters. It also utilizes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of card advantage and recursion. With access to powerful cards like Time Walk, Reanimate, and Demonic Tutor, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and control elements to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. By including powerful counter spells like Force of Will and disruptive cards such as Fatal Push and Daze, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and neutralize threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur low-cost creatures and artifacts from the graveyard. With a strong mana base and card selection tools, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday with Thassa's Oracle to win the game by manipulating the top of the deck and then winning the game in a single turn. The deck includes various ways to find and protect the combo pieces, such as cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, and tutoring spells like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor. It also includes extra draw spells like Gitaxian Probe and Treasure Cruise to help dig for combo pieces and ways to protect the combo.

The deck revolves around assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly by using a combination of card draw, control elements, and ritual effects to set up the perfect stack of cards for Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The key strategy is to efficiently dig through your deck using cards like Ponder and Preordain to find Doomsday and the necessary pieces to win in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Duress to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's threats.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base while establishing a quick, aggressive board presence. By using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, it can shut down non-basic lands and low-cost spells, giving it an advantage in resource denial. Additionally, it utilizes fast mana sources like Mana Crypt and Sol Ring to ramp out threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers early in the game. The deck's strategy revolves around putting pressure on the opponent while hindering their ability to respond effectively.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Grafdigger's Cage, Null Rod, and Blood Moon to prevent them from playing key cards or accessing certain resources. It also includes aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Burning Wish to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the game by denying the opponent their game plan while maintaining a strong offense to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell, while using Bazaar of Baghdad to filter through the deck. This allows for the Dredge mechanic to bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid from the graveyard to the battlefield. By combining these cards with other graveyard synergies like Silversmote Ghoul and Creeping Chill, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures and damage, leading to a quick victory through a powerful combo strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with creature cards and trigger powerful abilities such as bringing back creatures from the graveyard for free. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly assemble a critical mass of creatures in the graveyard and win the game through overwhelming board presence and recursive threats. The deck aims to utilize its graveyard as a resource and synergize different cards to create a powerful combo engine.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then utilize cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam to bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with constant threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to create a powerful board presence and win the game through synergistic interactions and graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Dredge creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, triggering effects that allow Prized Amalgam and Ichorid to enter the battlefield. This helps in generating a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent. The use of cards like Hollow One and Shambling Shell also aids in creating a fast and aggressive strategy. Control elements such as Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of threats from the graveyard.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and mana rocks to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to disrupt opponents' game plans. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently, utilizing the synergy between Eldrazi creatures and powerful lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to close out games before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It uses powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion for additional value. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate its mana development. With a mix of card draw, disruption, and efficient threats like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control spells, countermagic, card draw, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and maintaining board presence. It also uses Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide extra value by recurring low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game's tempo and resources, ultimately outlasting the opponent while setting up win conditions through card advantage and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countermagic and removal spells, with the ability to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It uses powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain an advantage, while also utilizing powerful artifacts like the Moxen and Black Lotus for mana acceleration. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade helps provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan in order to come out ahead in the long game.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo deck aims to quickly assemble the Food Chain combo using cards like Manipulate Fate and Trinket Mage. The key strategy is to generate infinite mana with Food Chain and then cast a large Hydroid Krasis or Walking Ballista for the win. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the game and protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces for a fast and consistent win.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down opponents while continuing to develop its own board presence with creatures like Witch Enchanter and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration in the form of fast mana artifacts like Moxen and Chrome Mox, as well as disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to further disrupt opponents. The deck aims to control the board through hate cards and aggressive creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that also disrupt the opponent's game plan through hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex, Null Rod, and Trinisphere. It aims to restrict the opponent's resources while deploying efficient threats like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Swords to Plowshares further enhances the deck's ability to control the game and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hate cards. By combining hatebears with acceleration from artifact mana, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the game through disruptive interactions. The inclusion of powerful hate cards like Trinisphere and Chancellor of the Annex further enhances the strategy by hindering opponent's ability to cast spells efficiently. With a mix of disruptive creatures and mana acceleration, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying consistent pressure to secure victory in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

A Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-Hatebear deck focused on disrupting opponent's plays with hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex while quickly building a board presence with creatures like Witch Enchanter and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to control the game with disruptive creatures and spells, while pressuring the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

This deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently, backed up by powerful mana acceleration and disruptive artifacts. The main objective is to deploy threats such as Stonecoil Serpent, Traxos, and Fleetwheel Cruiser as quickly as possible, supported by cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down the opponent's game plan. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide land destruction synergy, while Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void shut down opponent's key cards. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and disruptive elements.

This MUD deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient artifact creatures to pressure opponents and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing powerful artifact mana sources like Mishra's Workshop and Sol Ring, the deck can play threats ahead of curve while also taxing opponents with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. Additionally, cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void can shut down key opposing cards, allowing the deck to maintain board control and apply continuous pressure. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and disruption spells while utilizing the Oath of Druids combo with Atraxa, Grand Unifier to bring out powerful creatures quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes a few versatile tutor cards to search for key pieces and powerful spells like Show and Tell, Tinker, and Bolas's Citadel to further disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain advantage. The inclusion of cards like Null Rod and Oko, Thief of Crowns adds extra layers of disruption and control to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Narset, Parter of Veils early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Show and Tell and Flash to quickly put these creatures into play. To protect its strategy, the deck runs a suite of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as disruption like Thoughtseize and Demonic Tutor. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional control elements to help the deck maintain its advantage.

This deck relies on using Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana through bouncing artifacts back to hand. The key strategy is to generate enough mana and draw enough cards to assemble powerful combinations of cards, such as Time Vault and Voltaic Key, to win the game quickly. With access to counterspells and disruptive cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on efficiently utilizing artifacts and card draw to create dominant board states and win conditions.

This deck revolves around generating large amounts of mana and card advantage to quickly assemble a winning combination of cards, such as Time Vault and Voltaic Key, or The One Ring and Coveted Jewel. By using cards like Grim Monolith and Paradoxical Outcome, the deck aims to draw through the deck quickly and find the pieces it needs to win the game. Additionally, disruptive elements like Force of Will and Defense Grid help protect the combo pieces from removal or disruption from the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing the power of its combo pieces, such as Phyrexian Dreadnought and Lrien Revealed, to quickly achieve a game-winning board state. It also includes key control elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time allow for card advantage and digging for crucial pieces. The deck aims to assemble its combo efficiently while maintaining control over the game through counter spells and versatile threats.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with artifact ramp, utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand and draw cards, and then replaying those artifacts to generate more mana and card advantage. The goal is to assemble powerful artifact combos such as Time Vault with Voltaic Key or The One Ring with Coveted Jewel, while disrupting the opponent's plays with Force of Will and other control spells. The deck also includes powerful sideboard options like Karn, the Great Creator to further enhance the artifact synergy.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck revolves around utilizing the powerful combo card Underworld Breach to achieve a quick win. The deck includes various efficient cards such as Black Lotus, Moxen, and Ancestral Recall to maintain a fast pace. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast helps protect the combo and disrupt opponents. With the addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to consistently generate value and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of card advantage and disruption.
